comments.text:
I translate the recipe for you but it might not be 100% accurate due to my 
poor english translation skill. Also, the recipe that I translated is on 
their website not directly form the video, some steps might not quite match 
with the video here. So, I am apologise. But I think it will still come out 
the same, though. 

For 5 servings
Ingredients for The bread with grounded pork
minced cilantro root 1 tsp.
Finely chopped garlic 1 tbsp
Grounded pepper 1 tsp
Grounded pork 1 1/2 cup
Egg 1
Soy sauce 1 tbsp
Water 2 tbsp
Bread 10 slices
cilantro leaf 1bunch
Red chilli 1
Vegetable oil 4 cups

Ingredients for The sauce
Distilled vinegar 1 1/3 cup
Sugar 2 tbsp
Salt 1/2 tsp
Cucumber 4
Red chilli 1
Shallot 2 heads

Process:
Make the sauce by boil sugar, salt and the vinegar until reduce quite a 
bit. Take off the heat and let it cool until room temperature. Then, add 
cucumber, shallot and red chilli. Garnished with some cilantro leaves, when 
ready to serve.
Pound cilantro root, garlic and pepper until become fine paste. Add the 
paste to grounded pork along with half an egg (reserve the other for frying 
the bread). Add water and season with soy sauce. Mix well and kinda massage 
the meat until it gets sticky and pasty.
Slice the bread into bite size pieces and toast them in the oven until dry 
(150 Celsius for 10 minutes). Let it cool down a bit. Then, spoon the pork 
mixture on to the bread. The pork mixture should be kinda flat on the edges 
and round on the centre. Brush them lightly with the egg that preserve from 
step 2. Then, Garnish with cilantro leaf and finely diced red pepper.
Heat up the oil using medium-low heat. When the oil is hot, fry the bread. 
Pork side down first, until the edges of the bread is golden brown and then 
flip. Continue to fry the bread until golden brown. Then, rest on cooling 
rack.

Enjoy!
comments.author: Kamonpat K.

captions.text: Why did I choose fried bread with minced pork spread?
I chose it because
minced pork is commonly available.
And also the bread. They are the food we normally stock in our fridge.
So, it's the best choice to make this attractive and delicious finger food.
First, we need to prepare the dip.
Simmer the vinegar with sugar and a little salt.
It should be sweet, sour and a little salty.
Do not sniff the dip while cooking.
It will irritate your nose.
Cook until all the ingredients are mixed well
and the liquid reduces a little. Turn off the heat.
When you have finished the dip,
prepare the bread.
You can use sandwich bread or baguette, or even the leftover bread.
Once we have finished cutting the bread, ovendry them in the oven.
You can use a toaster or a griller.
Just make sure not to overcook them.
Set the temperature to 150 degree Celsius.
And set the timer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the pork.
We're going to mix it with coriander roots
and garlic.
Use Thai garlic, not Chinese garlic.
Add the pepper.
Pound finely.
Ah, very aromatic.
Use the minced pork without fat attached.
You can use rump.
But I'm using tenderloin this time. I'm going to chop it myself.
Add the light soy sauce
and about 2 tablespoons of water to season.
Crack the egg into a bowl.
Beat to combine.
Pour half of it into the minced pork.
The other half is for spreading on top of the pork
just before frying.
Use your hand.
When it is well blended and sticky like pork balls,
it is ready to spread over the bread.
Chili strips to garnish.
Once everything is ready,
spread the minced pork over the bread with the center sticking out in round shape.
You can let everyone in your family help you in this process.
So you will not be alone in the kitchen.
The beaten egg will help
stick the pork and the bread together,
and make them look great after frying.
Place each of the coriander leaves on every single slice of bread,
along with chili strips.
They are now ready to cook.
The oil is already hot.
I'm going to test it with drops of beaten egg.
Ah, very hot.
Fry with the pork side down.
You have to observe the change in color of each piece.
When they turn lightly brown, flip at once.
It smells tempting.
And really delicious!
Next, prepare the dip
to serve with the fried bread.
This is such a happiness.
With the sour and sweet dip
and the freshly fried bread with minced pork spread come together,
just one bite you can feel tenderness
as well as crunchiness
and the delicious taste in your mouth.
This snack will be finished in a flash.
Fried bread with minced pork spread is as easy as a pie.
I can do it and you can do it too. COOK IT YOURSELF!

title: CIY 012 : ขนมปังหน้าหมู (Fried bread with minced pork spread )
